text: I've updated Weblate to the most recent version and also registered the Microsoft translator with a free license -- so automatic suggestions using machine translation should be available for all R projects from now on

root.text:
As part of my poster on my "Internationalizing R packages" poster at useR! 2022, I've created a hosted version of Weblate to demo/experiment with how to crowd-source translations using a web interface instead of asking for code contributions -- also added all PO files from base R and the suggested packages at <https://translate.rx.studio> (can suggest translations without registration, but probably better to sign-up).

I'd appreciate any experimentation and feedback (let it be positive or negative), and happy to maintain it under a different domain of that's preferred and this tool looks useful.

FTR the PO files are picked up from the Subversion repo and can be auto-updated (e.g. daily), and happy to create patch files to share back to R Core.

attachments.text: This site runs Weblate for localizing various software projects.
